sentence: Technology stocks have turned narrowly lower, with shares of technology companies in the S&P 500 falling 0.1%.

In company news, Salesforce ( CRM ) shares were moderately higher today after the customer relationship management software company earlier Tuesday announced a $100 million initiative to develop new cloud-based products by investing in European startup companies.
European cloud companies in the year-old Salesforce Ventures portfolio include CartoDB, a mapping software-as-a-service provider, and quote-to-cash developer CloudSense.
CRM were up about 1% at $76.71 each this afternoon, easing from an earlier run to $78.30 a share.
(-) UTEK, (-6.1%) Reduced to Hold from Buy in downgrade at Stifel Nicolaus.
